column4: my BIOS is factory default already... I'm pretty sure I just need a driver.
for what?
wireless?
run "lspci -vvv" and see if the Ethernet device is listed there. if it is not, then you have BIOS or hardware issues.
it list ethernet controller, but I still have no idea how to get it to work. Thanks for your help
cat /etc/network/interfaces and tell me if you see eth0 or eth1
do NOT paste results to the channel
when you ran lspci, who makes the Ethernet chipset?
I think Intel
i doubt it's Intel. 99% of Intel wired network stuff "just works" in Linux.
do you have the Live CD/DVD around?
boot off that and see if the Ethernet interface works. if it does, something you configured on the installed system is causing the issue.
it's a fresh install- it didn't work off the live CD before either. Should I try again? Thanks for your time.
desktop or laptop?
examine the BIOS carefully. ensure the network interface is active.
Dell Dimension 8250, desktop
it's on the factory default settings- I'm not really sure what I can do
it worked before with the same settings- but when I removed and reinstalled ubuntu it stopped working
which release? Live or installed?

it worked with 8.10, but then I reinstalled ubuntu 9.10 from disk to overwrite everything. I was going to give the computer to my scout troop, but I ended up keeping it for some home networking usage; now it's just not connecting to anything.
if you are donating it, try 8.04 on it. it's an LTS release. 9.10 is not.
